IN CASE YOU DON"T KNOW THERE IS ALSO A REUNION COMING IN JULY 1999 (for that info contact Henry Jezek at jezek@stonemedia.com or John Ax at hq247ax@hotmail.com). Trying to locate: Anyone

Branch of Service: Army

Unit was: Company C 2/1infantry 196th Light Infantry Americal Brigade

Where served: Vietnam

When served:

Message is: I am trying to locate members of my father 1st Lt. Cecil Wright's comand. His unit was operating out of LZ Ross. He served from 1968-1969 He served with the 196th LIB, Company C, 2/1st infantry. His unit was doing search and clear operations east of Tien Phuoc on March 22, 1969 when they came under heavy fire from the NVA. My father manuvered his men through hostile fire to secure the area that was left open because of many wounded men. He then proceded to go and help assist taking care of the wounded while under heavy fire. He was wounded while doing this heroic act. He was then sent to a Japanese hospital for a month. Then he returned to the states. He is alive and doing well.

Please contact: Garret Kremer-Wright

Mailing address: 4206 Kaiser Lane

City, State, Zip: Jefferson City, Missouri 65109-8810

Or send email to Garret Kremer-Wright using this automatic email form"

Trying to locate: buddies of PFC Michael J. Lally ("Lal") KIA

Branch of Service: Army

Unit was: CO B/1st BN/20th INF/11th INF BDE/AMERICAL DIVISION

Where served: VIETNAM: Chu Lai, Duc Pho

When served: March-May 1970 (killed May 8, 1970)

Message is: After almost 30 years, my heart still aches for the man I loved and was going to marry when he returned from 'Nam. His death devastated me, but eventually I married another man. My husband felt that I never stopped loving "Lal" and that contributed to our recent divorce after 25 years of marriage. I'm now in therapy to deal with the horror, shame, anger and grief I still harbor from the Vietnam era. I've been devouring the letters he wrote me during his short, tragic time "in country," and I yearn to connect with ANYONE who served alongside Lal. He was a gentle soul--a rock'n'roll drummer from Red Wing,Minnesota. Easy-going, slender, dark hair, deep eyes, and a sweet crooked grin. He was shot in the chest (or so they said)and I never got a satisfactory account of what happened. I was too young, naive, intimidated by the military, and in shock to ask the right questions. His last letters had descriptions of some of his squad: LEE (squad leader from Kentucky) SLACKO (a Mormon from Utah) GREG (a guitar player from Iowa) UTCH (former squad leader from Pennsylvania) and AL (a soul-brother from Florida) ARE ANY OF YOU OUT THERE? OR ANYONE WHO HAD CONTACT WITH HIM DURING HIS MILITARY STINT FROM BASIC TO 'NAM? I implore you to contact me and help me find peace and understanding...In his memory, Lauri (he called me "Lor")

Please contact: Lauri Svedberg

Mailing address: 3359 Tyler Street NE

City, State, Zip: Minneapolis MN 55418

Or send email to Lauri Svedberg using this automatic email form"
